716579f.title: Manhattan: Battery Place - Washington Street
716579f.text:
Battery Place, north side, east from Washington, to and including
Greenwich Streets. Also sbown is Washington Street, east side, north from
Battery Place, to, but not including Morris Street.
About 1910.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
716579f.folder: Battery Place & Washington Street, Manhattan, NY

724051f-a.title: Manhattan: Washington Street - Battery Place
724051f-a.text:
WWashington Street, north from a point between Battery
Place a-d Morris Street (seen in the foreground) and showing
a view northeastward across Manhattan Svrian sector as viewed
frorn the Whitehall Bldg. In e foremround apnears a portion
of the steel frame work of the Downtown Athletic Club. Shortly
the adjacent rookeries will surplanted by the United Frnit Co.
Bldg. In the center and to the left of the Singer Tower
is the 23 storied Electric Bond and Share Bldg. at Rector Street.
June 20, 1929.
P.L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724051f-a.folder: Washington Street & Battery Place, Manhattan, NY

724054f.title: Manhattan: Washington Street - Battery Place
724054f.text:
Washington Street, west side, north from Battery Place to Morris
Street, as seen across Battery Park. On the left, is the Whitehall Building
(No. 1-14 West Street). Building bearing flag, is the Downtown Athletic
Club (No. 18 West Street).
About 1931.
Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724054f.folder: Washington Street & Battery Place, Manhattan, NY

724053f.title: Manhattan: Washington Street - Battery Place
724053f.text:
Washington Street, west side, north from, but not including Battery
Place, to and including Morris Street. Buildings shown face onto West
Street, and are from left to right, the Whitehall Building (No. 1-14), the
Downtown Athletic Club (No. 18), and No. 21 respectively. The background
shows piers and wharfs abuting onto the Hudson River.
About 1931.
Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724053f.folder: Washington Street & Battery Place, Manhattan, NY

716574f-a.text:

the Whitehall Building as photographed northwestward across
Battery Park. The framed view is taken from the Staten

No. 1: April, 1911

716578f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Place - Washington Street
716578f-b.text:
Battery Place, north side, east from Washington (left) to Greenwich
Streets (right). Note the Battery Place station of the Sixth and
Ninth Aves. Elevated Lines on Greenwich Street. The only building of this
row that bears a Battery Place number (No. 5) is the 4-story, center
structure; the corner buildings being (left) No. 17iWashington Street,
a 3-story, and No. 2 Greenwich Street, a 4-story affair. Shbwn on the
left; on Washington Street, are Nos. 17, 3-5, 7 and 9, at, adjoining
and north of the N.E. corner of Battery Place.
April 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(2)
A closer view, showing in the foreground the N.E. corner of Washington
Street and Battery Place.
April 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
716578f-b.folder: Battery Place & Washington Street, Manhattan, NY
